com.vijfhart.casus.tree

Interface TreeIterator<T extends Node<T>>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.util.Iterator<T>

    public interface TreeIterator<T extends Node<T>>
extends java.util.Iterator<T>
    An interface to iterate over Nodes in a Tree. This interface provides information about the level in the hierarchy, about the path of the node in the tree, if the node is a leaf node. The ordering of siblings can be specified. The iteration can be started at a given node.

    This interface is loosely inspired by Oracle's hierarchical query.

    • Method Detail

      • level

        int level()
        The level of the current node in the tree.
        Returns:
        0 if the current node is the root node of the tree (absolute, or relative as specified by startWith) otherwise a positive integer, indicating the distance between the current node and the root of the tree.

      • startWith

        void startWith(T t)
        Specifies at what node the iteration will be started. During the iteration, this will be the root of the tree.
        Parameters:
        t: - the node where the iteration will be started.

      • path

        java.lang.String path(java.lang.String separator,
                      java.util.function.Function<T,java.lang.String> f)
        Returns the path from the root node to the current node. This method uses a Function implementation (lambda expression or method reference) to specify what part of a node is shown in the path
        Parameters:
        f: - a Function to specify what String value of the node will be shown as part of the path.
        separator: - the String to separate the parts of a path
        Returns:
        the path from the root to the current node

      • path

        java.lang.String path(java.lang.String separator)
        Returns the path from the root node to the current node. This method uses toString as part of the node to be shown in the path
        Parameters:
        separator: - the String to separate the parts of a path
        Returns:
        the path from the root to the current node

      • orderSiblingsBy

        void orderSiblingsBy(java.util.Comparator<T> comparator)
        Specifies how siblings are to be sorted. in which the given Comparator is used to specify the ordering of siblings.
        Parameters:
        comparator: - a Comparator to specify the ordering of siblings.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this method is called after a call to next.

      • isLeaf

        boolean isLeaf()
        Returns true if the node is a leaf node.
        Returns:
        true if the node is a leaf node.
